solution.text:
If two forces are acting on an object in opposite directions, the net force acting on the object is the difference between the two forces.
Therefore, the net force will be zero only if the two forces are equal.
Thus, the net force will be zero when the two forces acting on the object are \(_{j}_N\) and \(_{j}_N\) OR \(_{k}_N\) and \(_{k}_N\).

content.text: The net force on an object is zero, if the two forces acting on it in opposite directions are ?
